sentences.chinese: 她停下，大笑了起來，看起來很訝異。

sentences.english: The waiter came up, eyes have surprised and embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 門口的服務生走上來，眼神中有訝異與尷尬。

sentences.english: I was surprised at his sudden appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他的突然出現令我訝異。

sentences.english: The boy's fecundity of imagination amazed his teacher.
sentences.chinese: 男孩想像力的豐富使老師感到訝異。

sentences.english: Gamerbee: I won't be surprised if the match goes either way.
sentences.chinese: 最後不管是哪一方獲勝我都不會感到訝異。

sentences.english: The true night should not astound.
A : I'm surprised we've made it this far with this shonky car.
sentences.chinese: 我很訝異這臺破車竟然能走這麼遠。

sentences.english: Next morning I was amazed at how little pain I'd felt.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上，我訝異地發現自己幾乎沒有任何疼痛感。

sentences.english: Why do these eyes of mine cry?
sentences.chinese: 訝異的覺醒我的眼還有淚。

sentences.english: Mayo forgot what she was going to say and stood straight up.
sentences.chinese: 真夜徹底忘了自己要說些什麼，令人訝異地站了起來。

definition: to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
